item.title: No Cha-cha hearings at House until year-end -- Rep. Rufus Rodriguez
item.description: "The Committee following the Speaker s suggestion will meet in January or February next year. We have to concentrate on the measures against COVID-19 and the 2021 proposed budget," Representative Rufus Rodriguez said in a message to GMA News Online Thursday.

item.title: 78 immigration employees get COVID-19; most asymptomatic
item.description: The Bureau of Immigration said Thursday that 78 of its rank and file employees have tested positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Jolo back to normal but gearing for another possible attack, mayor says
item.description: The mayor of Jolo in Sulu province on Thursday said situation in the area has returned to "normal" days after two suicide bombings left over a dozen people dead, although they are anticipating another terrorist attack.

item.title: Bayanihan 2 bolsters LGU mandate to tap SEF for blended learning
item.description: The Bayanihan to Recover as One bill or Bayanihan 2 would authorize local government units to use their Special Education Fund (SEF) for projects that would ensure learning continuity amid the COVID-19 pandemic, Senator Sherwin Gatchalian said Thursday.

item.title: CA stands by refusal to allow Maria Ressa s US trip
item.description: The Court of Appeals (CA) is standing by its refusal to allow Rappler CEO Maria Ressa to travel to the United States following her conviction for cyber libel.

item.title: P34-M shabu seized in Marikina; two suspects nabbed -PDEA
item.description: Anti-illegal drugs agents seized five kilos of suspected shabu, and arrested two suspects in a buy-bust operation in Marikina.

item.title: Retiradong pulis at anak na dating nakulong sa droga, pinatay sa Leyte
item.description: Patay sa pamamaril ang isang retiradong pulis at kaniyang anak sa Palo, Leyte, ayon sa Ronda Probinsiya portion ng Unang Balita nitong Huwebes.

item.title: WestMinCom chief Vinluan opposes martial law in Sulu
item.description: Western Mindanao Command (WestMinCom) chief Major General Corleto Vinluan Jr. on Thursday expressed opposition on placing the province of Sulu under martial law following the deadly blasts in Jolo town last Monday.

item.title: Anim na bilanggo sa Tabaco, Albay, tumakas
item.description: Anim na bilanggo ang nakatakas mula sa Tabaco District Jail sa Albay, ayon sa ulat ng Unang Balita nitong Huwebes.

item.title: Sara Duterte orders probe on Davao City grand wedding amid COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: Davao City Inday Sara Duterte-Carpio has expressed dismay over the grand wedding ceremony held in the city by a prominent family even amid the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a report by GMA Regional TV One Mindanao on Unang Balita on Thursday.

item.title: Bangkay ng lalaki na pugot ang ulo, natagpuan sa Baclaran
item.description: Isang bangkay ng isang lalaki na pugot ang ulo ang natagpuan sa isang sapa sa Baclaran, Paranaque ayon sa ulat ni Bam Alegre sa Unang Balita nitong Huwebes.

item.title: US troops injured in tense confrontation with Russians in Syria
item.description: Russian military vehicles and attack helicopters surrounded two US armored cars in a tense confrontation in northeastern Syria Wednesday, leaving US troops injured, according to the White House.

item.title: US now says asymptomatic people don't need virus test after exposure
item.description: After previously encouraging people without symptoms of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) to get tested if they have been exposed to someone who tested positive, US health authorities have abruptly reversed their position without a clear explanation.

item.title: The unarmed US blacks whose killings have sparked rage-filled protests
item.description: Their names are angrily chanted at demonstrations across the United States: they are the African Americans whose violent deaths this year at the hands of police or civilians have galvanized protests around the world.

item.title: Brazil hits 3.7M COVID-19 cases, death toll at 117,666 - ministry
item.description: Brazil reported 47,161 new cases of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and 1,086 deaths from the disease caused by the virus in the past 24 hours, the health ministry said on Wednesday.
